posts.post_content:
Posted By: Bob Bannon
Hi,

This past year my sister and I embarked on a project to rebuild a collection of the monster that had been stolen from our Dad years ago. All but 13 of his T206's that he began collecting some 50 years ago were taken. In less than 2 years we were able to assemble all but 59 cards and present it to him this past Christmas. It was a very tearful event.

I want to thank again the very many who helped us. Especially Chuck Paris who pushed us at the end and really made it feel robust. I will be in Chuck's debt for a very long time, literally and figuratively.

I think we have added time to our Dad's life through this. He has gone to a show and even went ON LINE! That is huge for him.

So I have grabbed back the album and we want to try and make a run at the 40 or so that are left that we might actually be able to find. This collection averages G. There are many Authentic cards and honestly anything identifiable works for us. Most are HOFers and SLers. Please let us know if you have any from this list to sell or trade.

Here is a list of those remaining that we need:

71 Carey,
98 Coles, 
99 Collins, Eddie Philadelphia
115a Dahlen Boston,
122b Demmit-St Louis,                           Yikes!!!!!
131 Donovan-portrait, 
143b J. Doyle NY hands above head, 
155b Elbefeld-Washington portrait, 
157 Ellam,
172 Foster, 
175 Fritz,
193 Guiheen,
202 Helm, 
206 Hickman,
213 Hooker, 
229 Johnson-hands at chest, 
244 Kiernan,
264 Lajoie-w/bat, 
287a Magie,                         Yikes!!!!!
291 Manion, 
300 Mathewson-white cap,
355b O'Hara-St Louis                Yikes!!!!!
362 Otey, 
367 Paige,
375 Perdue,
377 Persons,
395 Reagan, 
398 Revelle,
409 Ryan,
423 Seitz, 
429 Shaughnessy,
441 Smith-Atlanta, 
450 Stark,
470 Thebo,
473 Thornton,
484 Wagner-bat on left shoulder,



Please let us know if you have any from this list to sell or trade.

Thanks very much,  Bob Bannon      www.biggcards.com

biggies@aol.com 

"The best thing I ever saw never really happened at all."
- Guy in line at a Portalet outside Superbowl in San Diego

Posted By: dynarl
I have 9 Southern Leaguers that you need. Coles,Ellam, Foster,Fritz,Otey,Paige,Shaughnessy,Smith(Atlanta)and Stark. I am in the process of a trade for Kiernan and Revelle. I was looking forward to putting together the Southern League set when I saw your post. They are raw but maybe better grade then you are looking for. What do you have to trade? Thanks! D.

broughman@comcast.net

Posted By: Bob Bannon
Hi,

My dupes box is pretty fat and juicy with about 4000 cards from '48 to 1984 with mostly 50's and 60's cards. Alas, no pre war. 
If willing to sell, I'd love to see scans and prices.

Thanks, Bob

Posted By: dynarl
 Not interested in what you have to trade and don't sell cards. Sorry! D.

Posted By: Dan McCarthy
I have low-grade examples of the Young and Lajoie portraits. I'm looking for $350 for Young and $75 for Lajoie. Open to any offers as far as cash or trade goes, I'm interested in T205s, T3s, and Red Sox.

[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v402/collectbaseball/Young.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v402/collectbaseball/LaJoie.jpg[/IMG]

Posted By: Bob Bannon
Email sent Dan,

Thanks, Bob

Posted By: Bob Bannon
a bump
